services module

async services.authenticate_user(email: str, password: str, db: Session)[source]

Verify if a user exists within the DB and if their password matches with what’s stored in the DB.

Parameters

email: str

An email in plain text sent by the front-end.

password: str

A password in plain text sent by the front-end.

db: Session

A DB session.

Returns

user: Schemas.Employee | False

Returns an employee object if found in the DB, otherwise returns false.

async services.complete_task(task_id: int, db: Session)[source]

Change the complete status of a task to 1 if found in the DB, OW, raise a 404 HTTP exception.

Parameters

task_id: int

A task’s id.

db: Session

A db session.

Returns

task: Schemas.Task

A task object found in the DB.

services.create_db()[source]

Create a .db file using the structures defined in models.py.

Notes

Must delete the old .db file to avoid structure conflicts.

Example

To use this function, navigate to the folder that contains services.py, and do the following:

$ python  # To enter python terminal.
>>> import services
>>> services.create_db() # This will create a .db file.
async services.create_sprint(sprint: SprintCreate, current_employee: Employee, db: Session)[source]

Create a sprint obj and insert it into the DB using the data sent by the front-end.

Parameters

sprint: Schemas.SprintCreate

An object representing the data sent by the front-end whenever a user creates a sprint.

current_employee: Schemas.Employee

The current employee.

db: Session

A DB session.

Returns

sprint_obj: Schemas.Sprint

A successfully created sprint object.

async services.create_supervisor(supervisor: SupervisorCreate, employee: Employee, db: Session)[source]

Create a supervisor whose id, LN, FN are taken from employee table since a supervisor is one of the employees.

Parameters

supervisorschemas.SupervisorCreate

A template that represents user’s inputs and is used to create a supervisor.

employeeschemas.Employee

An employee object that’s retrieved from the database.

dbSession

A database session.

Returns

Supervisorschemas.Supervisor

The newly created supervisor.

async services.create_task(sprint_id: int, task: TaskCreate, current_employee: Employee, db: Session)[source]

Create a task with the given sprint_id.

Notes

Must be an authorized user to use this function on FASTAPI Docs.

Parameters

sprint_id: int

A sprint’s id.

task: Schemas.TaskCreate

Data sent by the front-end whenever a user creates a task.

current_employee: Schemas.Employee

The current employee who’s signed in.

db: Session

A DB session.

Returns

task_obj: Schemas.Task

A successfully created task.

async services.create_token(user: Employee)[source]
async services.create_user(user: EmployeeCreate, db: Session)[source]

Create a user using the info sent by the front-end.

Parameters

user: Schemas.EmployeeCreate

A response template representing the info inputted by the user.

db: Session

A database session.

Returns

temp_user: Models.Employee

A successfully created user using the given info for testing purposes, can also be tested on FASTAPI Docs ‘http://localhost:8000/docs’

async services.delete_employee(employee_id: int, db: Session)[source]

Delete an employee in the DB if found.

Parameters

employee_id: int

Employee’s id.

db: Session

A DB session.

Returns

None

async services.delete_sprint(sprint_id: int, current_employee: Employee, db: Session)[source]

Delete a sprint in the DB as well as all tasks associated to the given sprint_id.

Parameters

sprint_id: int

A sprint’s id.

current_employee: Schemas.Employee

The current employee.

db: Session

A DB session.

Returns

None

async services.delete_supervisor(supervisor_id: int, db: Session)[source]

Find a supervisor in the DB with the given supervisor_id. If found, delete that specific supervisor and change the ‘role’ of the associated employee to 0 (demote). OW, throw a 404 HTTP exception.

Parameters

supervisor_id: int

An id of a supervisor.

db: Session

A DB session.

Returns

None

async services.delete_task(task_id: int, db: Session)[source]

Delete a task in the DB using the given taks_id.

Parameters

task_id: int

A task’s id.

db: Session

A DB Session.

Returns

None

async services.get_all_supervisors(db: Session)[source]

Show all supervisors w/in the db.

Parameters

db: Session

A db session.

Returns

supervisors: list

A list of supervisor objects.

async services.get_all_tasks(current_employee: Employee, db: Session)[source]

Get all tasks associated to the current employee.

Parameters

The current employee.

Returns

async services.get_all_users(db: Session)[source]

Shows all users w/in the database. Same as SELECT * FROM EMPLOYEE.

Parameters

db: Session

A db session.

Returns

employees: list

A list of employee objects.

async services.get_current_user(db: Session = Depends(get_db), token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer))[source]
services.get_db()[source]

Retrieves a db session and close the db after each session.

Notes

Always use as dependency injection to open a db session before modify/update data inside a .db file.

async services.get_sprint_by_id(sprint_id: int, current_employee: Employee, db: Session) → Sprint | None[source]

Find a sprint in the DB using the given sprint_id. If not found, raise a 404 HTTP exception. OW, return a Sprint Object.

Parameters

sprint_id: int

A sprint’s id.

current_employee: Schemas.Employee

The current employee who’s signed in.

db: Session

A DB session.

Returns

sprint_db: Schemas.Sprint

A Sprint object.

async services.get_sprint_tasks(sprint_id: int, current_employee: Employee, db: Session)[source]

Parameters

A sprint’s id.

current_employee: Schemas.Employee

The current employee.

db: Session

A DB session.

Returns

tasks_db: list

A list of tasks associated to a sprint.

async services.get_supervisors(user: Employee, db: Session)[source]

Don’t remember why I created this function.

async services.get_task_by_id(task_id: int, db: Session) → Task | None[source]

Get a task within a DB using the given task_id. If a task is not found, raise a 404 HTTP exception, OW return a task object.

Parameters

task_id: int

A task’s id.

db: Session

A DB session.

Returns

task_db: Schemas.Task | None

A task object found in the DB.

async services.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session)[source]

Does a SQL query to find a user with the given email and return the first result since email is a unique column, meaning users can’t create accounts using the same email.

Parameters

email: str

User’s email.

db: Session

A database session.

Returns

user_obj: Schemas.Employee

An Employee object.

async services.get_user_by_id(id: int, db: Session)[source]

Does a SQL query using the given employee_id. If no user found, raise a 404 HTTP exception, otherwise, returns an Employee object found in the db using the given employee_id.

Parameters

employee_id: int

An employee’s id.

db: Session

A db session.

Returns

employee_obj: Schemas.Employee

An employee object found in the db with the given id.

services.hash_password(password: str) → bytes[source]

Hash the given password.

Parameters

password: str

User’s password in plain text.

Returns

hashed_pw: bytes

Hashed password ( user’s password in bytes ).

async services.update_sprint(sprint_id: int, sprint: SprintCreate, current_employee: Employee, db: Session)[source]

Find a sprint using the given sprint_id, and update its data (sprint_name)

Parameters

sprint_id: int

A sprint’s id.

sprint: Schemas.SprintCreate

An object representing data sent by the front-end whenever a user edits a sprint.

current_employee: Schemas.Employee

The current employee.

db: Session

A db session.

Returns

sprint: Schemas.Sprint

A successfully updated sprint.

async services.update_task(task_id: int, task: TaskCreate, current_employee: Employee, db: Session)[source]

Find a task using the given task_id, and update its data (task_name & task_info).

Parameters

task_id: int

A task’s id.

task: Schemas.TaskCreate

An object representing data sent by the front-end whenever a user edits a task.

current_employee: Schemas.Employee

The current employee.

db: Session

A db session.

Returns

task: Schemas.Task

A successfully updated task.

services.verify_password(password: str, db_password: bytes) → bool[source]

Check whether hashed password and inputted password are the same.

Parameters

password: str

User’s password in plain text (str).

db_password: bytes

The hashed password in bytes form, stored in the database.

Returns

is_matched: bool

A bool indicates whether or not 2 given passwords are the same.
